alert.note: Alert for Elliott; Morgan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 12:31PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Morgan and south central Elliott Counties through 100 PM EDT... At 1230 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lick Branch, or over West Liberty, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lenox around 1240 PM EDT. Elamton around 1245 PM EDT. Steele around 1250 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Elkfork and Jeptha. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
